hoi.core package#

Submodules#

hoi.core.combinatory module#

hoi.core.combinatory.combinations(n, k, task_related=False, as_iterator=True, as_jax=True, order=False)[source]#

Get combinations.

nint

Represents the total number of elements in the set

kint

Represents the size of the combinations to be generated

task_relatedbool, optional

If True, include an additional column in the returned array representing task-related behavior, by default False.

combsjnp.array

An array of shape (n_combinations, k) representing all possible combinations of k elements.

hoi.core.entropies module#

Functions to compute entropies.

hoi.core.entropies.cdistknn(xx, idx, knn=1)#

K-th minimum euclidian distance.

hoi.core.entropies.copnorm_1d(x)[source]#

Copula normalization for a single vector.

xarray_like

Array of data of shape (n_epochs,)

cxarray_like

Standard normal samples with the same empirical CDF value as the input.

hoi.core.entropies.copnorm_nd(x, axis=- 1)[source]#

Copula normalization for a multidimentional array.

xarray_like

Array of data

axisint | -1

Epoch (or trial) axis. By default, the last axis is considered

cxarray_like

Standard normal samples with the same empirical CDF value as the input.

hoi.core.entropies.ctransform(x)[source]#

Copula transformation (empirical CDF).

xarray_like

Array of data. The trial axis should be the last one

xrarray_like

Empirical CDF value along the last axis of x. Data is ranked and scaled within [0 1] (open interval)

hoi.core.entropies.entropy_bin(x: jax.numpy.array, base: int = 2) → jax.numpy.array#

Entropy using binning.

xarray_like

Input data of shape (n_features, n_samples). The data should already be discretize

baseint | 2

The logarithmic base to use. Default is base 2.

hxfloat

Entropy of x

hoi.core.entropies.entropy_gcmi(x: jax.numpy.array, biascorrect: bool = True, demean: bool = False) → jax.numpy.array#

Entropy of a Gaussian variable in bits.

H = ent_g(x) returns the entropy of a (possibly multidimensional) Gaussian variable x with bias correction.

xarray_like

Array of data of shape (n_features, n_samples)

biascorrectbool | True

Specifies whether bias correction should be applied to the estimated MI

demeanbool | False

Specifies whether the input data have to be demeaned

hxfloat

Entropy of the gaussian variable (in bits)

hoi.core.entropies.entropy_kernel(x: jax.numpy.array, base: int = 2) → jax.numpy.array#

Entropy using gaussian kernel density.

xarray_like

Input data of shape (n_features, n_samples)

hxfloat

Entropy of x

hoi.core.entropies.entropy_knn(x: jax.numpy.array, knn: int = 1) → jax.numpy.array#

Entropy using the k-nearest neighbor.

Original code: blakeaw/Python-knn-entropy and references. See also Kraskov et al., Estimating mutual information, Phy rev, 2004

xarray_like

Input data of shape (n_features, n_samples)

knnint | 1

K-th closest point. Default is 1 (closest point)

hxfloat

Entropy of x

hoi.core.entropies.get_entropy(method='gcmi', **kwargs)[source]#

Get entropy function.

method{‘gcmi’, ‘binning’, ‘knn’}

Name of the method to compute entropy.

kwargsdict | {}

Additional arguments sent to the entropy function.

fcncallable

Function to compute entropy on a variable of shape (n_features, n_samples)

hoi.core.entropies.prepare_for_entropy(data, method, y, **kwargs)[source]#

Prepare the data before computing entropy.

hoi.core.entropies.set_to_inf(x, _)#

Set to infinity the minimum in a vector.
